https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Chemostratigraphy, or chemical stratigraphy, is the study of the chemical signatures and their variations within lithological sequences to determine stratigraphic relationships. It includes the element of stratigraphy that deals with chemical signals as recorded in the stratigraphic record to identify spatial–temporal variations in the concentration and distribution of particular elements and isotopes (e.g. carbonate cycles and isotope cycles).

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Definition adapted from Wikipedia and Glossary of geology (5th edition revised; Neuendorf et al., 2011).
